alert.note: Alert for Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 3:37PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Southern portions of Natrona County near Pathfinder and Alcova Reservoirs, including a portion of Highway 220 near Pathfinder Reservoir. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Possible water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 333 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Roberts Draw, Horse Creek, Jackpot Reservoir Draw, Black Rock Draw, North Platte River, Sweetwater River, Pathfinder Mountain Draw, Arkansas Creek and Dry Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of South Central Natrona County near Pathfinder and Alcova Reservoirs - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
